fact_rock_001.content: There are rocks of all shapes and sizes
at the bottom of the pond.

fact_underwater_001.content: hiding places for small pond animals.

fact_underwater_002.content: tasty food for lots of pond animals.

fact_surface_001.content: that give frogs a place to sit
and warm themselves in the sun.

fact_surface_002.content: These floating lily pads have stems that
go all the way to the bottom of the pond.

fact_worm_001.content: Pond worms help keep a pond clean and healthy
by eating small bits in the water.

fact_worm_002.content: Pond worms are food for lots of animals,

fact_snail_001.content: Pond snails are like the ones on land...

fact_snail_002.content: Pond snails eat algae to help
keep pond water clear and clean.

fact_caddisfly_larvae_001.content: This larva is a baby Caddisfly.

fact_caddisfly_larvae_002.content: Caddisfly larva use rocks, plants and sticks
to build a hard shell around itself

fact_mayfly_larvae_001.content: This larva is a baby Mayfly.
It will grow up to have wings
and fly around the surface of the pond.

fact_mayfly_larvae_002.content: Mayflies are important food for many fish.

fact_scavenger_beetle_larvae_001.content: This larvae will grow into a Scavenger Beetle
and will be a fast swimmer.

fact_scavenger_beetle_larvae_002.content: These kinds of beetles eat things like insects

fact_tadpole_001.content: Tadpoles will grow and change to become frogs.

fact_dragonfly_larvae_001.content: This larva will grow up to be a dragonfly
that flies around the pond's surface.

fact_dragonfly_larvae_002.content: Adult dragonflies eat lots of different insects.

fact_diving_beetle_larvae_001.content: This larvae is a baby diving beetle
It can move through the water

fact_diving_beetle_larvae_002.content: These diving beetles eat all kinds of
plants and animals in the pond.

fact_red_spotted_newt_001.content: Newts live in the water and on land,

fact_red_spotted_newt_002.content: Newts eat lots of things in the pond,

fact_pumpkinseed_001.content: The pattern on the Pumpkinseed fish
because it looks like sunlight on the pond.

fact_pumpkinseed_002.content: top and the bottom of the pond to find food.

fact_spotted_bass_001.content: Spotted bass get their name from
the rows of spots on their bellies.

fact_spotted_bass_002.content: Spotted bass fish eat lots of animals,
including insects, worms, frogs and other fish.

fact_yellow_bullhead_catfish_001.content: to find food at the bottom of the pond.

fact_yellow_bullhead_catfish_002.content: Catfish eat lots of different foods.

fact_northern_pike_001.content: and eat other fish and frogs.

fact_northern_pike_002.content: to wait for food to catch.

fact_painted_turtle_001.content: Painted turtles look for their food
along the bottom and edges of the pond.

fact_painted_turtle_002.content: Painted turtles eat plants and small things

fact_map_turtle_001.content: It also eats small insects and fish.

fact_map_turtle_002.content: Map turtles love to sit in the sun on warm days.

fact_mosquito_larvae_001.content: Mosquito larva grow up to be

fact_kingfisher_001.content: who are great at... well, fishing!

fact_kingfisher_002.content: The kingfisher likes to sit on low branches
close to the water to look for food.
When it spots something it dives in!

fact_teal_duck_001.content: The teal duck eats by dipping its head
into the water along the surface.

fact_mallard_duck_001.content: Mallards eat by dipping their head
into the water along the surface,
and will go to the bottom of the pond

fact_heron_001.content: Great blue herons are wading birds.
That means they stand in the shallow water
